Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.general

Class GeoConversions

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.general.GeoConversions
public class GeoConversions extends Object
For an explanation of UTM, see Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system Original code thanks to .... Mind you the code was about as bad as any code could possibly be. I have tried to clean it up. Currently, there are errors, particularly in not using the zone (it only recognizes N or S when converting from UTC). A good online conversion tool is here: AWSM.

  • Method Details

    • position2UTM

      public static GeoConversions.UTM position2UTM(GeoConversions.Position p)
      Converts a geographic position, expressed as latitude and longitude, into Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinates. This involves determining the appropriate UTM zone, calculating easting and northing values, and selecting the correct hemisphere letter based on the latitude.
      Parameters:
      p - the geographic position to be converted, represented as a Position object containing latitude and longitude values in decimal degrees.
      Returns:
      a UTM object expressing the provided position in UTM coordinates, including easting, northing, zone, and hemisphere letter ('N' for northern hemisphere or 'S' for southern hemisphere).
